# Task 1:

1. The aesthetics are: 

- Income on the x-axis 

- Life expectancy on the y-axis

- Bubbles colored by World Region

- Bubble size by country population

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import plotnine as p9

my_data = pd.read_csv("C:/Users/mason/OneDrive/Desktop/GSB_544_Labs/Data/q1data.csv")

my_data
```


```{python}
Q1_plot = (
    p9.ggplot(my_data, p9.aes(
        x = "income", 
        y = "life_exp", 
        fill = "four_regions", 
        size = "population")) 
    + p9.geom_point(alpha = 0.7)
    + p9.annotate("text", x=20000, y=20, label="2010", # Found annotate function with Chat by asking how I could use to put faded letters behind my graph.
              size=80, alpha=0.1, color="gray")
    + p9.scale_x_log10 
    (
        limits=(500, 64000),
        breaks=[500, 1000, 2000, 4000, 8000, 16000, 32000, 64000],
        labels=["500","1k","2k","4k","8k","16k","32k","64k"]
    )
    + p9.scale_y_continuous
    (
        limits=(20,90),
        breaks=[20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90]
    )
)
Q1_plot

```
